subject: Data
title: Manipulating Chart Scales
description: A micro-lesson that makes Manipulating Chart Scales usable.

hook.text: Two charts show the same data. One looks like a gentle slope. The other looks like Mount Everest.

buildup.text: By changing the Y-axis scale, compressing or stretching the chart, identical data tells opposite stories.

discovery.text: A Y-axis from 0 to 100 makes small changes invisible. A Y-axis from 98 to 102 makes them look enormous.

twist.text: There's no universal rule for 'correct' scale. Context determines whether truncation is honest or deceptive.

climax.text: Always check the axis before trusting any chart. The scale is where most visual lies hide.

punchline.text: Same data, different scale, different story.

quiz.question: Where do most visual lies in charts hide?
options: In the axis scales and ranges
